roleset.name: to make dependent on a condition
roleset.note: CONDITION-V NOTES: Frames file for 'condition' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from condition.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: passive
example.text: `` If there is any support for [*] reducing the bill , it-1 is conditioned [*-1]on their desire [*] to see them passed [*-2] in another form . ''
example.arg: If there is any support for [*] reducing the bill
on their desire [*] to see them passed [*-2]in another form

example.name: Arg1, 2
example.text: The agreement's conditioning on total cooperation chafed the prosecution.

roleset.name: to accustom, to adapt
roleset.note: CONDITION-V NOTES: Frames file for 'condition' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from condition.02-v predicate notes)
CONDITIONED-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from conditioned.02-j)

example.name: passive
example.text: So two weeks ago , thousands of Brooks Brothers charge customers -- customers-1 conditioned [*]-1 [*-1]to wait for twice-yearly clearance sales -- got a surprise : an invitation [*] to come in and buy any one item for 25 % off .
example.arg: [*-1] to wait for twice-yearly clearance sales

example.name: Arg2
example.text: Complete conditioning to the altitude changes took some time.

example.name: Arg1
example.text: The patient diligently participated in physical therapy, to aid in his conditioning.

example.name: Arg0, 1
example.text: Pavlov's conditioning of his dogs is detailed in every introductory psychology text.
